name: Whodunnit
description:
The killer, the evidence, Something's Missing...   

You are a detective on board a winter train to Paris, when a grisly death catapults you and five suspects into an intricate game of danger and deceit.

Scour the train for evidence, interrogate the remaining passengers, and make your accusation before the train arrives and the killer escapes.


How to play (Please Read):

Whodunnit is a 3d person murder mystery game, where you hunt for verbal clues in dialogue with NPCs, and for physical evidence by exploring the train's extensive cars. Finding the murderer will not be easy, and making the wrong decision could have dire consequences, so choose wisely.

Start

Before the murder, talk to the other passengers if you want, or skip to the next phase by hitting interact (E) on your bed to sleep.

  Controls
  •   Mouse and Keyboard (required)
  •   WASD to move
  •   E - Interact with people/evidence
  •   Q - "Investigation mode"
  •   Tab/I - Inventory 
  •   While in the conversation portfolio, make accusations by dragging the clues to the evidence box (you have to talk to  the suspects to accuse them)
Accusations How to win:
  • You have 3 chances to make the correct accusation (you need the right suspect AND the right clue). When you make a correct accusation, or you get 3 wrong, the game will end.

 

Submitted as part of the Texas Aggie Game Developers Fall 2020 Game Jam
Theme: Something's Missing

Trailer Music: "Esther Abrami | No.2 Remembering Her"
